ygData.subject: RE: dual weild
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, I thought that if you get a skill at 15, the first point you put into it, starts you at skill 15.  Apparently, at least for this it s 2xlevel(maybe
ygData.messageBody:
> From: scott@... (scott brisko)
>
> I had an odd experience with training or not training duel wield.
>
> I hit level 17 and decided to head back to Kelethin to pick my new song. I
> knew that I could now use duel wield and that I probably need to point
> into
> it for it to work, but I forgot to train in Freeport before I left, and
> then
> when I arrived at Kelethin I forgot to train there as well.
>
> Now back in Freeport I went to the guild intent on putting some points
> into
> duel wield before I returned to hunting in Oasis. But to my surprise when
> I
> scrolled down to duel wield in the skills window I did not see the
> friendly
> "no charge" text, but a charge of 1 plat 3 gold. Hmmm.
>
> So off I went to oasis, equipped my dwarven axe and combine longsword and
> proceeded to pound crocs..
>
> You have become better at duel wield (35)
>
> So I am stumped. I never tried to use two weapons before, didn't train it,
> and all of a sudden I am starting out with a skill of 34.
>
> Any ideas?
>
Well, I thought that if you get a skill at 15, the first point you
put into it, starts you at skill 15. Apparently, at least for this it's
2xlevel(maybe for everything also). A long time ago, I had heard that for
duel wield, all you had to do was zone, and you automatically gained your
duel wield skill, I think I tried it and it worked.

Bien - Karana

> Bernwyn
>
>
>
>
>
